TopicTitle: KSP often stucks at loading screen

Articles.Content:
what i have done (major mods involved:hangar mod , space y heavy lifters expanded , tweakscale , kerbal joints reinforcement stockaline space station extension pack , KSPI extended) i have built a space station module for my existing space station (1 module is already docked)  and lift it into a rocket from space Y heavy lifters (expansion mod) and i docked to the station (after many effort) later on the station started to wabble (kraken) and then i time warp 5x then 1x for the kerbal joint reinforcement to take place and it worked , the wobble stopped then i decided to go back to space center and heres when the loading error happaned 

ERROR details: the game appears to not have crashed but to be frozen on a loading screen (black screen with a loading logo on bottom right) the game doesn't respond for 40 minutes (more than the initial initializing loading time takes) AN IMPORTANT DETAIL: the hard drive was overloading from the kerbal space program application (the computer runs smoothly but KSP is tottally frozen from overload) at can be an indication that ksp in the loading tried to write something on the hard drive but it failed constantly mods installed: 

 

  KSP: 1.9.1 (Win64) - Unity: 2019.2.2f1 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit

Edited April 29, 2020 by tonimark
adding logs (i was checking spoiler)

what i have done (major mods involved:OPT , engineignitor, kerbal joints reinforcement , KSPI extended) i have built a space shuttle out of skratch and i have tested it completely (launch, orbit ,re-entry and landing) after i crashed i decided to revert the flight to VAB in order to fix the design fails and then error happaned 

ERROR details: the game appears to not have crashed but to be frozen on a loading screen (black screen with a loading logo on bottom right) a clear indication from(toolbar controller) indicates that the game has loaded the vab but it won't finish the loading the game doesn't respond for 40 minutes (more than the initial initializing loading time takes) AN IMPORTANT DETAIL: the hard drive was overloading from the kerbal space program application (the computer runs smoothly but KSP is tottally frozen from overload) at can be an indication that ksp in the loading tried to write (or read) something on the hard drive but it failed constantly. the .craft file wasn't modified and my HDD is in great condition (also CPU is not used by KSP during the froze). mods installed:

 KSP: 1.9.1 (Win64) - Unity: 2019.2.2f1 - OS: Windows 10  (10.0.0) 64bit

i posted it here for attettion i just got this issue recently after 1 hour of ksp gameplay at any moment at loading screen (not that initial loading screen that you get when you start the game , that one when you revert flight , switching to vessels and etc...), flight reverting unloading vessels , going back to KSC will sometimes result in the ksp freezing up and unable to load whats unique about this errors is that the kerbal space program constantly uses the hard drive without stopping even after 1 hour (much more than the initial loading itself) which indicates that there is a constant read/write error loop of a speicific file maybe stock (or maybe modded since i use mods) for more details check up these topics:

 

 

Edited April 30, 2020 by tonimark
Hmm, to me this normally happens when you're PC/Computer is outdated or old, in my personal opinion, try to inform a Dev/Mod for assistance

Overlapping threads have yet again been merged.   Please do not crosspost identical or similar questions in separate threads.   It only leads to confusion and fractured answer/solutions.

As has been mentioned to you multiple times, your mod load is the most likely cause of your issues.  Try reducing the number of mods you are running, or try removing mods until you find the culprit that is causing your issue.

1 hour ago, PhilippineSpaceProgram said:

Hmm, to me this normally happens when you're PC/Computer is outdated or old, in my personal opinion, try to inform a Dev/Mod for assistance

outdated ?? i have windows 10 pro

1 hour ago, Gargamel said:

Overlapping threads have yet again been merged.   Please do not crosspost identical or similar questions in separate threads.   It only leads to confusion and fractured answer/solutions.

As has been mentioned to you multiple times, your mod load is the most likely cause of your issues.  Try reducing the number of mods you are running, or try removing mods until you find the culprit that is causing your issue. 

sorry , also this bug its completely random removing and checking may take a long time

20 minutes ago, tonimark said:

i have windows 10 pro

You can get win10 to run on some very bad potatoes.   And you can still run win XP, 95, or 3.1 on state of the art machines.   Aside from requiring 64 bit for later releases of the game, your OS will not have much to do with the issue.   In the "How to get support" thread, which is stickied at the top of the tech support sub forum, which has also been linked many times to you, it asks for the specs of your computer.   RAM, processor, HDD, etc.   This is stuff we need to help you out. 

23 minutes ago, tonimark said:

sorry , also this bug its completely random removing and checking may take a long time

That's the problem with running so many mods.   You add one more, and all of a sudden, it doesn't work right.   And yes, it takes a very long time, and is very tedious to sort through them.   If you suspect it's a mod conflict, remove half of them, and see if it works.   Keep adding or removing half the remaining mods until you've narrowed it to one.   Then you can decide if the mod in question is worth doing with out.

1) Look in the logs.

2) Find where it crashes.

3) Find what's causing the crash.

4) Take it to the relevant mod's main thread, or even better, create an issue on the git repository.

5) Stop using that mod until a fix is released.

15 minutes ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

1) Look in the logs.

2) Find where it crashes.

3) Find what's causing the crash.

4) Take it to the relevant mod's main thread, or even better, create an issue on the git repository.

5) Stop using that mod until a fix is released.

I’ll agree with all except #4.  Don’t create an issue on Github unless you have gotten responses on the forum.  Most likely its a user error (missing dependency, etc).  Save the github issues for real bugs.

There are one or two modders who only respond to githib issues, so follow what the OP says in that case.

2) Find where it crashes.

3) Find what's causing the crash.

4) Take it to the relevant mod's main thread, or even better, create an issue on the git repository.

5) Stop using that mod until a fix is released.

i said again ITS NOT A CRASH the game just freezes
Why is it so hard for you to accept that you just use too many mods for your PC to handle?

It's quite possible the computer ran out of memory, or possibly the GPU ran out (doubtful).  

I found this interesting:

[KSPI]: GameEventSubscriber - detected OmPartDestroyed
